chunk_analysis.page_text:
BOOK405 PAGE547 517

and which descended to his two sons, William Elroy Rankin and Riddle S. Rankin, under the intestate laws of Pennsylvania; said tract of land became wholly vested in the said Riddle S. Rankin, one of the above named grantors, by deed of William Elroy Rankin, et ux. dated March 20, 1909, and recorded in Washington County, in Deed Book 364, page 349.

EXCEPTING AND RESERVING all the coal of the Pittsburg or River Vein in and under the above described tract of land, together with mining rights and privileges, as fully set forth in deed of the said Riddle S. Rankin to Chartiers Mining Company dated March 25, 1913, and recorded in Washington County in Deed Book 405, page 355.

THIS CONVEYANCE IS ALSO MADE SUBJECT to the right of the Tri-State Gas Company to maintain a gas line across said premises; also subject to the right of the Hickory-Woodrow Mutual Telephone Company to maintain a telephone line across said premises; also subject to a telephone line along the Hickory-Burgettstown public highway.

And the said Riddle S. Rankin, one of the above named grantors, will warrant generally the property hereby conveyed.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the said grantors have hereunto set their hands and seals, the day and year first above written.

Sealed and delivered
in presence of
J. M. K. Donaldson
Margaret Donaldson
W. E. Rankin

Riddle S. Rankin (Seal)
Jennie C. Rankin (Seal)

STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA
COUNTY OF WASHINGTON } SS

On this 4th day of June A. D. 1913, before me, a Notary Public in and for said County and State, came the above named Riddle S. Rankin and Jennie C. Rankin, his wife, and acknowledged the foregoing deed to be their act and deed, and desired the same to be recorded as such.

Witness my hand and Notarial seal, the day and year aforesaid.

J. M. K. Donaldson
Notary
My Commission Expires February 6, 1917.

Recorded and compared. June 7, 1913. J. C. Sutherland, Recorder. Per H. H. B.

ELEANOR HANSON, ET AL.
TO
CHARTIERS MINING COMPANY.

THIS DEED, MADE the 26th day of April in the year Nineteen hundred and thirteen, Between Eleanor Hanson (widow of James Hanson, deceased), J. Kyle Hanson and Jennie, his wife, Ella J. Rankin and William E., her husband, Anna M.
